title: Connecting a Message via an association to a MessageFlow?
body:
I got a question regarding a special modelling style. The question is how do you connect the message decorator to a message flow correctly. 

First option would be to put it directly on the message flow as shown in the BPMN 2.0 spec on page 411 (see MessageFlow_V1 below)

Second option would be to connect the Message decorator via an undirected association to the message flow (see MessageFlow_V2 below). 

I am wondering now if the MessageFlow_V2 example is actually valid BPMN 2.0 and interchangeable with the XML serialization.

From my point of view it is no valid BPMN 2.0 as Message is no FlowElement and therefore cannot be referenced by the BPMNShape element in the BPMNDI part which makes it impossible to place the Message decorator to any arbitrary position as done in MessageFlow_V2.

Additionally there is no BPMNShape listed in the spec for the single message symbol (table 12.35 on page 411). Sections BPMNShape (Section 12.3.2) and BPMNEdge (Section 12.3.3) also supports this. So I would say the meta model of BPMN 2.0 does not support this.

MessageFlow_V1: Message Flow with Message decorator
![message association v1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3901085/1296823/8604011e-30d2-11e3-9cbf-835453a08d74.png)

MessageFlow_V2: Message Flow with Message decorator connected via association
![message association v2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3901085/1296822/860353cc-30d2-11e3-9246-fb6122b51c85.png)

title: Use of schemaLocation differs
body:
As may be seen here: http://tools.bpmn-miwg.cloudbees.net/xml-compare/Yaoqiang%202.2.6-A-roundtrip.html, when one tool specifies the schemaLocation but the other does not this is highlighted by the xml-compare tool.

After discussion at the meeting 4th Sept 13 we recommend that the tool to continue to show this but we should indicate it is a subject of differing practice so of lesser importance.

title: Extra un named lane added in Pool
body:
The BPMN serialization of A.4.1 contains an extra lane without label in the left pool.
It is impossible for someone to know this when trying to reproduce the provided images.

title: Extra pool added around laneset
body: The laneset containing "lane 1" and "lane 2" is not contained in a Pool in Reference A.4.0.  Should be in the variation

title: Labels do not have bounds
body:
Label Bounds are missing in BPMNDI
Label positioning information is done via proprietary extensions
Thus any tool that import this reference needs to resolve to default label poistion.
The reference A.4.1 image does not show labels in their default position

title: Add results for A.4.1 and new camunda-bpmn.js renderer
[Reference] [B.1.0] [B.2.0] Odd spaces in identifiers
body:
The new B.1.0 and B.2.0 tests introduced a regression: The name attribute values of elements often have odd spaces.
E.g., ``` name="Collapsed Sub- Process 1 Multi- Instances "``` in the following BPMN file.

**Link to B.2.0.bpmn**:
[Link](https://github.com/bpmn-miwg/bpmn-miwg-test-suite/blob/master/B%20-%20Validate%20that%20tool%20covers%20conformance%20class%20set/Reference/B.2.0.bpmn)

**Excerpt from B.2.0.bpmn**:
```xml
        <semantic:parallelGateway gatewayDirection="Unspecified" name="Parallel Gateway 2 " id="_397c783e-ad6a-4cf3-8266-9b41962c83bd">
            <semantic:incoming>_8321494b-9c3c-483a-b4d2-79e6254211c0</semantic:incoming>
            <semantic:incoming>_b41b9c86-bc41-4b6e-ac32-70e1342e6128</semantic:incoming>
            <semantic:incoming>_de249cbe-d431-4e1f-bc8c-a90aec438683</semantic:incoming>
            <semantic:outgoing>_2752e07c-f2e4-4384-8721-70e4abea9765</semantic:outgoing>
        </semantic:parallelGateway>
        <semantic:callActivity calledElement="" completionQuantity="1" isForCompensation="false" startQuantity="1" name="Call Activity calling a Global User Task " id="_a74c1d4d-db90-43ff-8920-139a300b39a5">
            <semantic:incoming>_be19c2da-316a-47f6-ad7b-eb6c82bf8609</semantic:incoming>
            <semantic:outgoing>_ce63770e-9f4b-4bc0-a56c-88401c59f0bf</semantic:outgoing>
        </semantic:callActivity>
        <semantic:subProcess triggeredByEvent="false" completionQuantity="1" isForCompensation="false" startQuantity="1" name="Collapsed Sub- Process 1 Multi- Instances " id="_149a6e1d-0385-4d0f-a90c-c2150a291a67">
            <semantic:incoming>_e0fbb051-0e07-43cc-a8bf-158492541c0f</semantic:incoming>
            <semantic:outgoing>_dbae7e12-67c2-4256-8c50-5811c207ba55</semantic:outgoing>
            <semantic:multiInstanceLoopCharacteristics isSequential="false"/>
        </semantic:subProcess>
        <semantic:dataObjectReference dataObjectRef="DF1372433666499" name="Data Object " id="_aa8c769a-276c-4589-b182-7c7bbd0a9e1e"/>
 ```

**Interpretation:**
* It appears as if linebreaks are transformed to whitespaces by the tool exporting the BPMN files.
* This is a problem for the XPATH test automation, because it cannot find the correct elements anymore.

**Options:**
The following options for resolving this issue are possible:
* Fix the BPMN files by removing all spaces which stem from linebreaks.
E.g., ```"Collapsed Sub- Process 1 Multi- Instances "``` becomes ```"Collapsed Sub-Process 1 Multi-Instances"```.
* Fix the BPMN files by removing all non-trailing spaces which from from linebreaks.
E.g., ```"Collapsed Sub- Process 1 Multi- Instances "``` becomes ```"Collapsed Sub-Process 1 Multi-Instances "```.
3. Adapt the XPATH tool in order to ignore spaces completely.
In this case, the tests will work with strings like ```"CollapsedSub-Process1Multi- Instances"```. The tests will remain unchanged.

title: [Reference] [B.1.0] [B.2.0] calledElement Attribute missing
body:
**Output from the xpath tool for B.1.0:**
```
Running tests for M:\MIWG\bpmn-miwg-test-suite\B - Validate that tool covers conformance class set\Reference\B.1.0.bpmn:
> TEST BPMN Schema Validator
Error Line 77: cvc-datatype-valid.1.2.1: '' is not a valid value for 'QName'.

Error Line 77: cvc-attribute.3: The value '' of attribute 'calledElement' on element 'semantic:callActivity' is not valid with respect to its type, 'QName'.

  > Assertion Validation failed: FINDING: Warnings 0, Errors: 2, Fatal Errors: 0
```

**Reference XML B.1.0.bpmn**
```xml
<semantic:callActivity calledElement="" completionQuantity="1" isForCompensation="false" startQuantity="1" name="Call Activity Calling a Global Task " id="_fa3a8e53-5be0-4f0b-8680-d2498e255209">
    <semantic:incoming>_eeb6812d-d182-489f-aea2-493ab8732cfd</semantic:incoming>
    <semantic:outgoing>_61abe245-5604-46ba-8152-94d6e68ffda4</semantic:outgoing>
</semantic:callActivity>
```

**Interpretation:**
* The *calledElement* attribute has an empty value.
* The same problem occurs in *B.2.0*.

title: Issue 16632: XML Schema: Usage of xsd:anyAttribute instead of xsd:attribute (bpmn2-rtf)
body: http://www.omg.org/issues/bpmn2-rtf.open.html#Issue16632

title: Syntax Error: Link Events not connected
body:
Reference model B.2.0 contains a catching and a throwing link event that have different names and are therefore disconnected. This is equivalent to having two sequence flows that are not connected and therefore represents a syntactical error.

```xml
        <semantic:intermediateThrowEvent name="Intermediate Event Link Throw" id="_f27040d5-765c-493c-bbe7-9fb6ad04cbdc">
            <semantic:incoming>_78361e03-8ab9-4317-b8f6-2daa90f20f54</semantic:incoming>
            <semantic:linkEventDefinition name="Intermediate Event Link Throw"/>
        </semantic:intermediateThrowEvent>
```

```xml
        <semantic:intermediateCatchEvent parallelMultiple="false" name="Intermediate Event Link Catch" id="_4f5e6e50-d9d0-4f97-959a-d1b8e1e32788">
            <semantic:outgoing>_c9768243-8e1a-4b09-907b-3f27fa831a6e</semantic:outgoing>
            <semantic:linkEventDefinition name="Intermediate Event Link Catch"/>
        </semantic:intermediateCatchEvent>
```

Proposal:
Give both Link Event Definitions the same name.

title: Inconsistency in the use of the 'X' indicator on gateways
body:
On page 290, the BPMN specification recommends that

> A diagram SHOULD be consistent in the use of the “X” internal indicator. That is, a diagram SHOULD NOT have some Gateways with an indicator and other Gateways without an indicator.

As agreed in our last meeting, the reference files B.1.0 and B.2.0 should therefore be changed in order to honour this best practice recommendation.

Displaying the Xs in one of the two diagrams and omitting them in the other will ensure that both cases can still be tested.

title: Inconsistency between B.2.0.bpmn and B.2.0.pdf
body:
I think there is an error in either the bpmn or the pfd file.

In the bpmn file, the label for the "Inclusive Gateway 1" is ABOVE the gateway:

\<bpmndi:BPMNShape bpmnElement="_dec393e7-f182-4d31-b05f-e33ac3a5e35f" id="S1368567295078__dec393e7-f182-4d31-b05f-e33ac3a5e35f">
                \<dc:Bounds height="42.0" width="42.0" x="569.0" y="67.0"/>
                \<bpmndi:BPMNLabel labelStyle="LS1368567294511">
                    \<dc:Bounds height="36.27136901041668" width="105.60000000000001" x="535.0503937007874" y="30.061165888492283"/>
                \</bpmndi:BPMNLabel>
            \</bpmndi:BPMNShape>

The label's y position is above the gateway's y location.

The pdf, however, depicts the label BELOW the gateway.

title: Incorrect label bounds in reference file A.4.0.bpmn (and others)
body:
The 'width' and 'height' values within the label bounds of lanes seem to be inverted. "Lane 1", for instance, defines a label with 'height="12.80..."  and width="35.59...", hence representing a horizontal rectangle. The label, however, is supposed to be displayed vertically.

According to the Diagram Definition (DD) specification, the size of the rectangular described by the bounds is specified along the x-y axes. The bounds should therefore always be relative to the x-y axes, independently of the label's direction. If the label is depicted vertically, its bounds should also represent a vertical rectangle.

It could be argued whether an additional 'direction' or 'angle' attribute is needed for labels. At least for the moment the direction can be derived from the shape's 'isHorizontal' attribute.

Also see:
Diagram Definition (DD) spec: Bounds, page 9
BPMN spec: BPMNLabel, page 377
